drivers.name: Alexander Rossi
bio: Alexander Rossi, hailing from the historic city of Rome, Italy, has etched his name in the annals of Formula S Racing as one of the sport's most talented and determined drivers. Born on March 15, 1991, Rossi's journey into the world of high-speed racing began at a young age, inspired by the rich motorsport heritage of his home country. Standing tall at 182 cm, Rossi combines physical fitness with mental acuity, making him a formidable presence on the track.

Rossi's entry into Formula S was met with great anticipation. Since his debut, he has competed in 97 Grand Prix, amassing 1024 points, a testament to his consistency and skill. With 18 podium finishes to his name, Rossi has frequently showcased his ability to compete at the highest level, culminating in a world championship victory that solidified his status as one of the sport's elites.

His first victory was a defining moment in Rossi's career, demonstrating not only his racing prowess but also his strategic mind, capable of out-manoeuvring his competitors in the heat of the moment. Rossi's highest grid position, starting first, is a further testament to his exceptional speed and ability to handle the immense pressure that comes with leading the pack.

Off the track, Rossi is known for his dedication to the sport, spending countless hours with his team, and fine-tuning his vehicle to perfection. His date of birth and place of birth are not merely details of his life but markers of a legacy in the making, with Rossi representing the passion and drive of Italian motorsport on the global stage.

As Rossi continues to compete, his sights are set on further world championships, aiming to add more victories to his already impressive record. His journey from the historic streets of Rome to the pinnacle of Formula S Racing is a testament to his unwavering determination, talent, and the spirit of competition that defines the heart of a champion.

Miguel Santos continues to chase glory in Formula S Racing, driven by the dream of securing more world championships and solidifying his legacy as one of the greatest drivers in the sport's history.
